title.narrative: OPT 1.1.1: DEMAND HEALTH HIV AIDS

description.narrative: 1.1.1 Boys, Girls, adolescents, mothers, fathers, families and communities in the intervention area are competent in maternal/child health, and HIV prevention., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Hiv Prevention, Maternal And Newborn Health, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1.1 By 2017, high impact interventions in maternal/child health and HIV/AIDS are being equitably used by children, adolescents and mothers from the most disadvantaged communities in the intervention area

participating-org.narrative: UNIDAD DE ANALISIS DE POLITICAS SOC Y ECONOMICAS

sector.narrative: Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1.1 Boys, Girls, adolescents, mothers, fathers, families and communities in the intervention area are competent in maternal/childhealth, and HIV prevention.

description.narrative: Communities and families in the Tropic of Cochabamba and Rural Potosi received support to enhance awareness about essential care for pregnant woman, newborns, as well on healthcare and HIV prevention. The actions aimed at empowering and mobilizing women leaders of social organizations, and strengthening their links to the Health Networks. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of schools in the intervention area that develop HIV preventive actions with adolescents participation
